title: 'She can make her own decision': HC allows Christian woman to live with Muslim partner - The News Minute
content:
1. 'She can make her own decision': HC allows Christian woman to live with Muslim partner  The News Minute
  2. "Married The Person I Loved": Win For Kerala Couple In 'Love Jihad' Row  NDTV
  3. Kerala HC declines to interfere with interfaith relationship of Christian woman, Muslim DYFI leader  The Indian Express
  4. Kerala HC dismisses ‘love jihad’ charge, allows interfaith couple to stay together  Hindustan Times
  5. DYFI Muslim Leader Marries Christian Woman, Ignites Political Row: Kerala HC Disposes Habeas Moved By Her ...  Live Law - Indian Legal News
  6. View Full coverage on Google News
description: Joisna Mary Joseph is a woman capable of making her own decisions, observed the Kerala High Court, while hearing a habeas corpus petition filed by her father Joseph who wanted her to return home. Joisna, a Christian woman in Kerala, married a Democratic Youth Federation of India (DYFI) leader Shejin by exchanging garlands, and soon after, then approached the court with a habeas corpus plea. A habeas corpus is a type of petition seeking the appearance of a particular person before the court.
